qas.question: On what date did Frédéric begin his journey into Western Europe?
Which country did Frédéric go to first after setting out for Western Europe?
In what year did his companion Woyciechowski depart to Poland to enlist for the uprising in Warsaw?
What historian commented that the events involving Frédéric's friend in Poland contributed to his maturing?
Who said that Chopin set out "into the wide world, with no very clearly defined aim, forever?"
Who did Chopin leave for Austria with?
Where did Chopin intend to go after Austria?
Woyciechowski left Chopin to enlist in what?
What geographicla region was opened for Chopin due to his composing and performances?
When Chopin started to take his music to the world, what is the last name of the person who went with him to Austria?
What year did the uprising begin in Warsaw?
What were the words Chopin wrote to a friend when he was alone and homesick?

answers.text: "I curse the moment of my departure."

qas.question: What year did Chopin learn that the uprising in Warsaw was crushed?

context: Chopin's successes as a composer and performer opened the door to <a8_0>western Europe<a8_0/> for him, and on <a0_0>2 November <a10_0>1830<a10_0/><a0_0/>, he set out, in the words of <a3_0><a4_0>Zdzisław Jachimecki<a4_0/><a3_0/>, "into the wide world, with no very clearly defined aim, forever." With <a5_0><a9_0>Woyciechowski<a9_0/><a5_0/>, he headed for <a1_0>Austria<a1_0/>, intending to go on to <a6_0>Italy<a6_0/>. Later that month, in Warsaw, <a7_0>the November <a2_0>1830<a2_0/> Uprising<a7_0/> broke out, and Woyciechowski returned to Poland to enlist. Chopin, now alone in Vienna, was nostalgic for his homeland, and wrote to a friend, <a11_0>"I curse the moment of my departure."<a11_0/> When in September <a12_0>1831<a12_0/> he learned, while travelling from Vienna to Paris, that the uprising had been crushed, he expressed his anguish in the pages of his private journal: "Oh God! ... You are there, and yet you do not take vengeance!" Jachimecki ascribes to these events the composer's maturing "into an inspired national bard who intuited the past, present and future of his native Poland."
